target_name: Achieve universal health coverage, including financial risk protection, access to quality essential health-care services and access to safe, effective, quality and affordable essential medicines and vaccines for all
computation_definitions:
Estimated data by international organizations (Type2)
This is Korean data prepared by international organizations through estimation and modeling.
If there are no national data corresponding to UN SDGs indicators, international data are available for monitoring.
indicator_definition: An index reported on a scale of 0 to 100, which is computed as the geometric mean of 14 tracer indicators of health service coverage.
computation_calculations:
Indicator 1. Family planning: Population-based health surveys
Indicator 2. Pregnancy and delivery care: Household surveys and routine facility information systems.
Indicator 3. Child immunization: Household surveys and facility information systems
Indicator 4. Child treatment: Household surveys
Indicator 5. Tuberculosis treatment: Facility information systems, surveillance systems, population-based health surveys
Indicator 6. HIV/AIDS treatment: Facility reporting systems, sentinel surveillance sites, population-based surveys
Indicator 7. Malaria prevention: Household surveys
Indicator 8. Water and sanitation: Household-level responses
Indicator 9. Prevention of cardiovascular disease: Population-based surveys and surveillance systems
Indicator 10. Management of diabetes: Population-based surveys and surveillance systems
Indicator 11. Tobacco control: Household surveys
Indicator 12. Hospital access: Administrative systems, Health facility reporting system
Indicator 13. Health workforce: National database or registry of health workers, ideally coupled with regular assessment of completeness using census data, professional association registers, or facility censuses.
Indicator 14. Health security: Key informant survey
title: Untitled
